page.title: 15TOURISM
page.content: Portobello became a{holiday resort}for Edinburgh families in the 18th and 19th centuries when{seabathing}became fashionable. Even around 1960 "Porty" was still being described as {"Edinburgh's bracing holiday resort." Today, although no longer a major resort, Portobello retains something of a resort character, with many guest houses and small hotels, bars, public parks and{promenade}with its{amusement {centres}and summer entertainment. Unfortunately many seafront buildings have been neglected but some amenities have been improved e.g. the{beach}is the subject of continuous treatment to maintain sand levels and the seawater is cleaner for{water sports}since the Seafield sewage works opened. However in an age of mass international tourism it is unlikely that Portobello could return to past glories.
